poem:
Title: Linking Arcs of Mystery

Between Tell's arrow and Joan's burning flame,
Quiz of ages whispered in the game.
Cooper's ghost flight in '71, a sinister tale,
Villa Diodati's horrors, under moonlight pale.

Brick behemoths guarding London's sphere,
Arcade's tilt warning brings a shiver of fear.
Parker leads on, through peace or rejection,
Darwin through Spencer seeks natural selection.

"Fire control," pressed, ends the deafening silence,
Within our histories, bound by timeless violence.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links William Tell with Joan of Arc? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 What did DB Cooper do in 1971, the only such unsolved crime in the US?2 Which horror stories were first told at the Villa Diodati?3 What is London’s biggest brick building?4 Which arcade game features a tilt warning?5 Quanah Parker led which people in war and peace?6 Which Darwinian phrase was actually coined by Herbert Spencer?7 “I pressed the fire control". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
